This article outlines some of the differences and responsibilities of the HOA and CDD. What is the difference between the Lake Bernadette Community Development District (CDD) and the Lake Bernadette Homeowners Association (HOA)?  They actually have both separate and shared responsibilities for our community. Lake Bernadette HOA The Lake Bernadette Community Association, also known as the HOA, helps maintain the Community and deals with overall conditions of the neighborhoods.  The HOA ensures that the Covenants and Restrictions are adhered to regarding the appearance and quality standards of the Community.  This includes areas such as yard maintenance, home appearance and upkeep, and parking. The HOA may issue fines to homeowners who don't abide by the Covenants and Restrictions and may even place a lien against the home for broken rules and unpaid fines. The dues paid to the HOA are used to cover expenses such as community trash, recycling pickup, property management, and legal expenses. The HOA Board of Directors consists of five Lake Bernadette homeowners who volunteer their time to manage the HOA. The HOA contracts with a management company, Greenacre Properties, Inc. who assists the board with the day-to-day operations of the community. CDD Information The CDD is a type of government entity that provides the Community its infrastructure such as roads, utilities, water management, street lighting and amenities such as the Club House, the playground and the pools. Staff who manage the Clubhouse and other amenities are employees of the CDD.  Additionally, there is a CDD district manager employed by Infamark, who provides for Lake Bernadette's infrastructure management. The CDD has a five-person governing board of supervisors elected by homeowners. The CDD allowed the developer to finance the cost of the community development with a tax-free municipal bond.  The "bond" is repaid by the homeowners in the community with each property charged an annual amount.  It shows on the homeowner’s tax bill each year and is collected by the Pasco County Tax collector. The CDD and HOA have complementary responsibilities and share some community responsibilities such as the maintenance of Golf Links Boulevard and the ponds. The Lake Bernadette Golf Club is an independent entity.  Also, neither the HOA nor the CDD have any policing powers. 0 HOA Community Contact Us The information on this website will help you navigate the ins and outs of community and living at Lake Bernadette HOA. If there is any information that you lack or just a question you may have, please call our office at 813-936-4115. Meetings | Lake Bernadette CDD Skip to Main Content Open main menu Search Site Home Links Events Documents Contacts Information Show sub menu for Information About the CDD Amenities Finances Meetings Questions Services Website Accessibility Important Phone Numbers Home Meetings Board Meetings The Board of Supervisors of the Lake Bernadette Community Development District will hold their meetings at the Lake Bernadette Clubhouse, 5410 Golf Links Boulevard, Zephyrhills, Florida 33541. Meetings may be continued to a date and time certain, which will be announced at the meeting. There may be occasions when one or more Supervisors will participate by telephone. Any person requiring special accommodations at this meeting because of a disability or physical impairment should contact the District Office at (954) 603-0033 at least forty-eight (48) hours prior to the meeting. If you are hearing or speech impaired, please contact the Florida Relay Service by dialing 7-1-1, or 1-800-955-8771 (TTY) / 1-800-955-8770 (Voice), for aid in contacting the District Manager’s Office. Each person who decides to appeal any decision made by the Board with respect to any matter considered at the meeting is advised that person will need a record of the proceedings and that, accordingly, the person may need to ensure that a verbatim record of the proceedings is made, including the testimony and evidence upon which such appeal is to be based. Best Value in Pasco County New ownership as of 2022. Overall improvements to the golf course including tees, greens, and fairways. Newly renovated clubhouse. Tee Times Learn More > Email Club Learn More > Scorecard Learn More > News & Events Learn More > My Homepage Welcome to The Links of Lake Bernadette! Primary Sidebar Weather Sorry - your browser does not support iframes. meteoblue Our Course Welcome to The Links of Lake Bernadette, a semi-private golf club just north of Tampa. Designed by Dean Refram, the course opened in 1980 and uses Florida’s natural landscapes to be a challenge to players of all skill levels. The Links of Lake Bernadette is a beautifully landscaped and mature course with rolling fairways, towering pines, and spectacular golf. Click here to read more about our course. Tampa Tribune has said that Lake Bernadette is Pasco county’s best kept secret. Golf Digest has also rated The Links as the “Best Overall Value” in Tampa Bay. Are you new to the game? Are you a seasoned veteran? Players of all ages and skill levels are rewarded with challenging golf and a little southern hospitality. The Links of Lake Bernadette continues its tradition of old-fashioned value and great food that keeps players coming back year after year. Enjoy a full Liquor bar, beer and wine in the club house while watching your favorite sports team on one of many flat screen televisions. Make your tee time today. What We Do About White Rock Lake Get Involved Lake Life Donate (214) 660-1100 info@whiterocklake.org What We Do Second Saturday Shoreline Spruce Up Adopt a Shoreline Padillacs Texas Stream Team Celebration Tree Grove Events About White Rock Lake Map Activities White Rock Lake Park History Lady of the Lake Get Involved Who We Are Volunteer Donate Support Us by Shopping Sponsor us Contact Us Lake Life About For the Love of the Lake For the Love Of The Lake’s mission is to preserve Dallas’ urban oasis, White Rock Lake Park. We are a non-profit organization whose volunteers support programs to preserve and enhance White Rock Lake Park. We organize monthly clean-up activities, regularly support various clean-up groups, collaborate with Dallas Park and Recreation to host volunteers for tree planting events, and raise money needed to fund improvements, all to benefit White Rock Lake Park. Founded in 1996, For the Love of the Lake is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt nonprofit organization (Charitable ID #: 75-2835902), and we rely on private donations to fund that work. In fact, 100% of the budget needed to keep the Park beautiful and vibrant comes from individual donors. As a donor to For the Love of the Lake, you are helping maintain this unique urban oasis. Every donation is 100% tax deductible. Dallas Park & Recreation We work in conjunction with Dallas Park & Recreation to preserve and enhance White Rock Lake Park. Read More × LAKE BERNADETTE RESIDENTS: If you are unable to login, please re-register. Thanks! Welcome To The Lake Bernadette Community Lake Bernadette is a serene neighborhood in West Zephyrhills, named after the 22-acre lake located within the community. The Lake Bernadette Community offers a blend of tranquility and community spirit. It is home to The Links at Lake Bernadette , a semi-private golf club that is popular among the residents of the community. Our community is characterized by well-maintained homes, quiet streets and a community-centered environment. Activities within the Lake Bernadette Community include golf, tennis, pickleball, fitness and games. While local parks, theaters and shopping are just a short distance away. The peacefulness, coupled with the area's natural beauty, makes the Lake Bernadette Community one of the premier communities in Pasco County. The Community Learn more about Lake Bernadette Homeowner's Association (HOA). Read More... Meet The BOD Meet the Current Board of Directors for the Lake Bernadette HOA. Read More... The Links of Lake Bernadette, Zephyrhills, FL - Scorecard & Overview Join Now Log In Book a Tee Time Find a Course Learn Equipment Instruction Lifestyle Tour Golf Travel All Articles Resources Find Driving Ranges Find Golf Simulators About Us Find golf lessons Newsletter Join Now Log In Newsletter Search Courses Enter Keyword Home Courses FL Zephyrhills Public 3 7 Reviews The Links of Lake Bernadette Designed by Dean Refram and opened in 1984 Links of Lake Bernadette - Zephyrhills , Florida Course Details Scorecard Flyover Views Yardage Maps Reviews Nearby Courses Course Details Holes: 18 Par: 71 Length: 6400 yards Slope: 119 Rating: 69.9 Driving Ranges: No The 18-hole "Links of Lake Bernadette" course at the The Links of Lake Bernadette facility in Zephyrhills , Florida features 6400 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 71. The course rating is 69.9 and it has a slope rating of 119. The estimated green fees for 18 holes is $45. Designed by Dean Refram, the Links of Lake Bernadette golf course opened in  1984. Estimated Green Fees $45 These rates are an estimate of what you might expect to pay at Links of Lake Bernadette with a cart. Actual rates may vary. Fees are typically lowest Monday through Thursday and during twilight (late afternoon and evenings). Expect to pay the highest rates on weekends. Reviewed January 09, 2024 Bought a home in Lake Bernadette 2 years ago , course was in poor shape then , but new owners were taking over soon, made some improvements the first year it ended there  , now course is going downhill again last year my season member ship was $ 1500 for 4 months( I am here 3 months in the winter)  got here this year and it's a 6 month membership for $ 2100. Restaurant is closed most of the time, no help they say , Management never says hello and most times they act like you are bothering them, I now Play at Silverado about 2 miles away , great condition and they are happy you are there, and the membership is cheaper , sad I was looking  forward to living on a course for my winters. Read More Robert K. Reviewed November 30, 2021 Read More Frank V. Reviewed September 07, 2020 Great course for the price. Friendly staff. Read More Gene A. Reviewed April 13, 2012 A disappointment...Greens were in rough condition, even had a temporary green on #9...A decent layout with some interesting holes but it needs alot of TLC.... The score cards have pin placements 1,2,or 3, but when we asked the starter which number was correct he said " there is no number, its just random"..No driving range, was a let down. Not priced down low enough to compete with other courses in the area that are in much better shape. Read More Austin W. Reviewed November 10, 2011 I played this course for the first time last week.  The course was extremely damp, but I think that may have been due to recent over seeding.  The course is fairly short, but plays fairly long due to frequent dog legs and forced layups.  Their are several tricky holes that will play very tough if you are not familiar with the course.  The course was in decent shape, a few greens are still being worked on, and there was some weeds growing in a few fairways but overall it was in pretty good shape.  The staff was friendly and my hot dog was pretty good, but the clubhouse is not going to impress anyone.  The best part of the experience was the pace of play.  I played on a beautiful Sunday morning at 10.  Normally playing at a public course in central florida at that time would mean a 5 and a half hour round.  We get through 18 in under 4 hours, not bad at all.  I'm not sure if it was an anomoly or not, but if this is the norm, we will be back for another Sunday round.  Good rates can be found online, we paid 20 a head on a weekend, and it turned out to be a great value.  I will definitely be back in the future. Read More Jim M. Reviewed June 13, 2011 My wife and I enjoyed this course we played at twilight and it was like we had the course to ourslves would go again. The only issue is they close the on course bathrooms down early. Kind of funny though we had to go track down the course ranger. Read More Larry D. Reviewed January 05, 2011 Tough course but could be be better. Clubhouse is a dog,and  prices too high for quality. Owner has a great course in Tallahassee, FL. too bad he didn't make this one to the same standards. Club Info - The Links of Lake Bernadette Skip to main content Skip to primary sidebar Skip to footer The Links of Lake Bernadette Zephyrhills, FL Home Tee Times Links Email Club Club Info Rates Coupons News And Events Pro Shop Scorecard Announcement Grill Menu Memberships Photos Contact Us Book Tee Times Club Info Rates subject to change and may vary on holidays or special events. For Online Specials please visit our Tee Times page and for other special deals at Lake Bernadette, please visit our News and Events page. Rates Effective October 30 – December 31 (ALL RATES ARE Tax included) Weekday: Mon-Fri Open – 10:52 am- $37 11:00 – 1:52 – $32 2:00 – Close – $25 Weekend: Open – 10:52 am- $40 11:00 pm – 1:52 pm $35 2:00 pm – Close: $25 9 Holes: $20- walk ins are allowed- to book 9 holes it is only after 1:00 pm 18 Hole Replay: $20 9 Hole Replay: $15 Club Info The Links of Lake Bernadette is a challenging,  yet fair test of golf.  At 6,400 yards from the Back tees it can play longer as there is a nice mix of longer par 3’s and par 4’s with some strategic shorter Par 3’s, 4’s and 5’s.  With a par of 71, the course sets up well for players of all skill levels.  There are 5 sets of tee boxes including a recently added Silver tees for juniors, or golfers who need some yardage help. Water hazards and bunkers come into play but they are balanced by large greens and wide fairways that make for easier approaches.  A few of the signature holes include: #4 a dogleg left Par 5 with many options on how to make Par or Birdie; #14 a longer Par 4 that will take 2 good shots to assure your Par; and #18 a tough finishing hole requiring 2 precise shots. Blue Tees- 6484 yards White Tees- 6044 yards Gold Tees- 5423 yards Red Tees- 4998 yards Silver Tees- 4256 yards We hope you enjoy your outing at Lake Bernadette. While you are our guest, we ask that you follow these simple guidelines: Please be courteous on the course. Allow faster players to play through your group for the enjoyment of everyone. Please repair your divots and ball marks, and level footprints in the sand traps. Please keep your carts away from tee areas and greens. Disabled guest flags are available upon request. Please observe our dress code at all times- Collared shirt or acceptable T shirt. Please do not bring personal coolers unless it is necessary for medical purposes. The Links prefers that all players have soft spikes. If you have any questions or concerns about our guidelines, our pro shop staff will readily assist you. The Links at Lake Bernadette has a fully-stocked Pro Shop with everything you will need for your round.  We carry a wide selection of Wilson, Bridgestone, Taylor Made, and Srixon Golf balls. Gloves from Wilson and Bridgestone. Book Your Next Event Here! – For more information on booking your next event at Links of Lake Bernadette please call 813.788.7888 . Our spacious clubhouse and friendly staff will make your next event a memorable one! The Links of Lake Bernadette pro shop offers a variety of products and pricing for all of your golf needs.  From our popular “Swamp Balls” to Titleist, Callaway, Bridgestone and everything in between- we have options for all golfers.  We also offer the latest wedges, putters and woods from Callaway.  Finally, Lake B has upped its game in the hat and glove areas as well!! Our knowledgeable staff is ready and waiting to help start off your day at The Links right!
